hanzi-su-wiki:
火

Значения

Огонь; огонь, свет, вспышка

🔑86

Мнемоника


Огонь виде пирамиды дров, справа и слева — искры.

Описание

Пламя, по обеим сторонам которого летят искры,— таков образ, передаваемый как пиктограммой, так и современным иероглифом. Огонь, символ тепла, силы, опасности и злости, проявляется во всех сферах нашей жизни, например, в виде удачи или невезения. В прошлом, когда невеста впервые входила в дом мужа, она проходила через горячую жаровню. Считалось, что это поможет ей надолго сохранить способность к деторождению.

Написав после этого ключа иероглиф «цветок», получим «искру», которую китайцы поэтически называют цветком пламени. Поставив этот ключ перед иероглифом «гора», получаем «вулкан» — горящая гора. Совместно с иероглифом «тележка» этот ключ дает «поезд». В сочетании с иероглифом «воздух» он образует «злость» или «гнев»: нет ничего более непредсказуемого и опасного, чем смесь воздуха и огня.

heisig_chinese_memo: A person running, her arms raised up, because she caught on fire!
heisig_story: Just as sitting before a fire enlivens the imagination and lets you see almost anything you want to in the flames, this kanji is so simple it lets you see almost any sort of fire you want to see. It no longer makes a good pictograph, but I invite you to take a pencil and paper and play with the form - first writing it as shown below and then adding lines here and there - to see what you can come up with. Everything from matchbooks to cigarette lighters to volcanic eruptions to the destruction of Sodom and Gomorrah have been found here. No doubt you, too, will find something interesting to bend your memory around these four simple strokes.
koohiiStory1: For some reason, this kanji reminds me of a person running, her arms (the two drops) raised up, because she caught on fire!

origin_of_ch_char_book: The monument features the three supreme existences of the Universe: Heaven (天), Earth(地), and Human (人)— and the five basic elements of the universe: water(水), fire(火), iron (金), wood(木), soil(土) (14th-19th century) ,Woman writing with a brush pen (18th–19th century) In modern China, this is the character that is used to signify reading a book: (書, 书, shu, book) On the top there is a hand, and underneath the character is the bottom of the tree (本, ben, root). Like the stump of a tree, a person holds a long, stubby pen tool. Below is a fire (火, huo, fire) burning for the ancestral rite, and a mouth that means words at the rite. This character describes someone recording the words of various people performing at the memorial service. It is now used to mean a book. (論, 论, lun, essay; discuss) The left symbolizes a forthright statement like a spear (言, yan, speak). Upper right corner is a roof or lid that collects something in it. And there are wood pieces with various records tied up together . The ancients have written a lot of records on bamboo sticks, and they discuss together whether these records are right or wrong. Therefore, this character has become to mean logical theory or a rational discussion.,The ancient Chinese considered that there were five essential elements in the universe: Water (水, shui), Fire (火, huo), Wood (木, mu), Iron (金, jin), and Earth (土, tu). The five main elements interact and create each other or restrain each other. For example, the tree burns and creates fire which burns down to ashes and becomes earth (soil). Water restrains fire and fire can melt metal. (五, wu, five) contains such philosophical meanings. The top line means sky , the bottom line is earth , and the middle shows how the “five elements” cross and interact with each other.
humanum_full_description_en:
Elaboration: The oracle " fire " is like a rising flame, more dynamic than the shape of a mountain. The original meaning is fire.

The characters " fire " and " mountain " in the oracle bone inscriptions are not easy to distinguish. The biggest difference is that " fire " has two points and " mountain " does not, but " fire " is often not added. The bottom curvature of " mountain " and " fire " are also different. The character for " mountain " is generally flat, and the character for " fire " is generally curved. Scholars generally distinguish two characters from their rhetoric. See " mountain ". The word " fire " is not seen in the inscriptions. The character " Fire " in the Warring States period was lined up, and a stroke that was originally tilted up from left to right was written down to left and right, and a horizontal pen was added to the vertical pen for modification.

The word " fire " oracle bone inscriptions is used as the original meaning, such as "He Ji" 30774: "Fire does not extend." Extension means continuation, the whole sentence means that fire will not continue. It can also be used as a star name, that is, Mars, or Antares. For example, "Collection" 11503: "㞢 (Yes) new big stars are on fire." And there is the meaning of juxtaposition (Liu Xinglong). "The Book of Songs. Bin Feng. "July": "July Flowing Fire ", also using " Fire " as the abbreviation for Mars. The word " fire " in Oracle can also be used as a name.

Because the sounds of " fire " and " misfortune " are close, and " fire " is also one of the disasters, " fire " can also be used as " misfortune " in the inscriptions (Chen Weizhan). For example, "Collection" 34797: "Death in ten days (no) fire" means that there is no disaster in ten days.

"Shuowen": "Fire, ruin. Travel in the south, the flame will rise. Pictogram. All fire belongs to the fire." "Fire, ruin also" belongs to the sound training, referring to the flame when an object burns.

humanum_full_description:
甲骨文「火」象火焰上騰之形，比山之形較有動態。原義是火。

　　甲骨文「火」與「山」字不易區分，最大分別為「火」有兩點而「山」無，但「火」字亦往往不加點。「山」和「火」的底部弧度亦不同，「山」字一般較平，「火」字一般較彎。學者一般從其辭例判別兩字。參看「山」。「火」字未見於金文。戰國文字「火」字經過綫條化，把本來左右向上翹起的一筆寫成左右向下，又在其豎筆上再加一橫筆作修飾。

　　「火」字甲骨文用為本義，如《合集》30774：「火不延。」延是延續的意思，全句指火災不會延續。另可用作星名，即大火星，或稱心宿二。如《合集》11503：「㞢(有)新大星並火。」並有並列靠近的意思(劉興隆)。《詩經．豳風．七月》：「七月流火」，亦以「火」作為火星的簡稱。甲骨文中「火」字也可用作人名。

　　由於「火」、「禍」音近，而且「火」亦屬災禍之一，因此「火」於卜辭中又可通假作「禍」(陳煒湛)。如《合集》34797：「旬亡(無)火」，就是十日沒有災禍的意思。

　　《說文》：「火，燬也。南方之行，炎而上。象形。凡火之屬皆从火。」「火，燬也」屬聲訓，指物體燃燒時的火焰。
humanum_short_description: 甲骨文象一團火，本義是火焰。

Мнемоника


Огонь виде пирамиды дров, справа и слева — искры.

Описание

Пламя, по обеим сторонам которого летят искры,— таков образ, передаваемый как пиктограммой, так и современным иероглифом. Огонь, символ тепла, силы, опасности и злости, проявляется во всех сферах нашей жизни, например, в виде удачи или невезения. В прошлом, когда невеста впервые входила в дом мужа, она проходила через горячую жаровню. Считалось, что это поможет ей надолго сохранить способность к деторождению.

Написав после этого ключа иероглиф «цветок», получим «искру», которую китайцы поэтически называют цветком пламени. Поставив этот ключ перед иероглифом «гора», получаем «вулкан» — горящая гора. Совместно с иероглифом «тележка» этот ключ дает «поезд». В сочетании с иероглифом «воздух» он образует «злость» или «гнев»: нет ничего более непредсказуемого и опасного, чем смесь воздуха и огня.
